texto: Due to the presence of high expansive clays, a minimal thickness of the subgrade soils will be stabilized with lime immediately beneath the pavement section as required to reduce the Potential Vertical Rise (PVR) to specific values.

Design for all structural elements has been based on the Load Resistance Factor Design (LRFD) methodology as presented in the most recent AASHTO LRFD Bridge Design Specifications. All of SH 130 bridges are precast pretensioned concrete I-beams with the exception of one steel girder span in one of the 5.1 interchange bridge connector.

New Tx I-beam girders (especially TX 54) have been adopted for the whole Project. This type of beams allows increasing girder spacing which reduces the number of beams. It also helps reduce the number of bents and embankment heights by increasing the span length.
